ticket.title: Regexp selection of priority zones in time_zone_select
ticket.original-body:
Per Geoff Buessing's request in #195, this patch implements =~ on ActiveSupport::TimeZone for selection of zones based on a match of name or TZInfo identifier in the MAPPING hash for easier localization. I had to flesh out the TimeZone mock a little more for testing, there may well be a better way to do this because this is my first Rails patch submission.
I'd really appreciate any input.

version.body: Hey Ernie, the patch looks good to me, but could you attach it to the original ticket? Let's keep work on this issue in one place. Thanks :)
version.body-html: Hey Ernie, the patch looks good to me, but could you attach it to the original ticket? Let's keep work on this issue in one place. Thanks :)
version.title: Regexp selection of priority zones in time_zone_select

version.body: Sure. Sorry. Was going to, but instructions for submitting patches called for creating a ticket with the tag patch. Just following directions. ;D
version.body-html: Sure. Sorry. Was going to, but instructions for submitting patches called for creating a ticket with the tag patch. Just following directions. ;D
version.title: Regexp selection of priority zones in time_zone_select

version.body: Actually, I'm just stupid. It said "Attach the patch to a lighthouse ticket and add the patch tag." Never said I needed to create the ticket. :) Anyway, updating now.
